paris-france.name: Paris, France
dos: Learn basic French phrases like 'Bonjour' and 'Merci'
Try authentic French pastries from local bakeries
Visit museums early morning to avoid crowds
Take evening Seine river cruises for best views
Explore neighborhoods beyond tourist areas
Dress well - Parisians appreciate good style
donts: Don't eat at tourist restaurants near major attractions
Don't be loud in public transportation
Don't expect shops to be open on Sundays
Don't tip excessively - 5-10% is sufficient
Don't wear athletic wear outside of gyms
Don't rush through conversations - take time to be polite

london-uk.name: London, United Kingdom
dos: Stand on the right side of escalators in the Underground
Carry an umbrella - weather can change quickly
Book restaurant reservations in advance
Try traditional afternoon tea experience
Use contactless payment - widely accepted
Respect queuing etiquette - it's taken seriously
donts: Don't block tube doors when boarding
Don't expect free water at restaurants
Don't drive in central London unless necessary
Don't touch the Queen's Guards or horses
Don't be surprised by early pub closing times
Don't assume all museums are free (though many are)

rome-italy.name: Rome, Italy
dos: Dress modestly when visiting churches and Vatican
Book tickets online for major attractions to skip lines
Try authentic Roman dishes like Carbonara and Cacio e Pepe
Walk on ancient cobblestones with comfortable shoes
Throw a coin in Trevi Fountain with your right hand
Learn basic Italian greetings - locals appreciate the effort
donts: Don't eat dinner before 8 PM - restaurants open late
Don't order cappuccino after meals - it's breakfast only
Don't touch ancient monuments and artifacts
Don't expect air conditioning everywhere in summer
Don't drink from the tap near monuments - use nasoni fountains
Don't wear flip-flops to Vatican - dress code is strict

trivandrum-india.name: Trivandrum, India
dos: Dress modestly when visiting temples
Try authentic Kerala cuisine and coconut water
Respect local customs and traditions
Use sunscreen and stay hydrated
Learn basic Malayalam greetings
Book Ayurvedic treatments in advance
donts: Don't wear leather items in temples
Don't drink tap water - stick to bottled water
Don't point feet towards people or religious items
Don't eat street food if you have a sensitive stomach
Don't ignore monsoon season warnings
Don't be surprised by power cuts during summer

kochi-india.name: Kochi, India
dos: Take a sunset cruise through the backwaters
Explore Jew Town and antique shops
Try fresh seafood at local restaurants
Watch Kathakali dance performances
Visit spice markets for authentic spices
Use auto-rickshaws for short distances
donts: Don't forget to bargain in markets
Don't miss covering your head in religious places
Don't swim alone in unknown waters
Don't expect everything to run on time
Don't refuse hospitality - it's considered rude
Don't photograph people without permission

mumbai-india.name: Mumbai, India
dos: Use local trains during non-peak hours
Try street food at Mohammed Ali Road and Juhu Beach
Book movie tickets at iconic single-screen theaters
Walk along Marine Drive in the evening
Visit Dharavi for authentic local experience
Carry cash as many places don't accept cards
donts: Don't travel in local trains during rush hours (7-11 AM, 5-9 PM)
Don't drink tap water - stick to bottled water
Don't venture out alone late at night in unknown areas
Don't be surprised by traffic jams and honking
Don't ignore monsoon flooding warnings
Don't refuse chai when offered - it's part of culture

delhi-india.name: Delhi, India
dos: Use Delhi Metro for efficient transportation
Try street food at Chandni Chowk and Connaught Place
Visit monuments early morning to avoid crowds
Carry a pollution mask during winter months
Bargain at markets like Karol Bagh and Lajpat Nagar
Respect security checks at monuments
donts: Don't drink tap water - always use bottled water
Don't walk alone in isolated areas after dark
Don't be surprised by aggressive vendors
Don't ignore air quality warnings
Don't eat raw salads from street vendors
Don't expect everything to be on time

jaipur-india.name: Jaipur, India
dos: Visit forts early morning to avoid heat and crowds
Try traditional Rajasthani cuisine like Dal Baati Churma
Shop for textiles and jewelry in local bazaars
Respect photography rules in palaces and temples
Hire official guides for historical sites
Carry water and wear comfortable walking shoes
donts: Don't ignore dress codes at religious sites
Don't buy expensive items without bargaining
Don't venture out during extreme summer heat (May-June)
Don't touch or climb on ancient structures
Don't expect English everywhere - learn basic Hindi phrases
Don't refuse traditional hospitality - it's considered rude

varanasi-india.name: Varanasi, India
dos: Take a sunrise boat ride on the Ganges
Respect the spiritual significance of ghats
Try famous Varanasi street food like chaat and lassi
Visit during Ganga Aarti for spiritual experience
Dress modestly when visiting temples
Book accommodations near ghats for authentic experience
donts: Don't point feet towards the river or temples
Don't take photos of funeral ceremonies without permission
Don't drink Ganges water - stick to bottled water
Don't wear leather items near temples
Don't be surprised by crowds and chaos - it's part of the experience
Don't ignore local customs and traditions
